title: How safe is this?
content:
The makers of the Avada theme for WordPress adviced to set dom.events.testing.asyncClipboard to true for the copy paste function between sites. A function they have added recently.

However, here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1411533 I saw this comment:

"Recommendations to flip dom.events.testing.asyncClipboard to true are a fundamentally bad idea. This pref was meant for automated testing, and bypasses all security/permission checks on clipboard access.

If you toggle this pref, any site has full access to your clipboard all the time without asking you or you even noticing so we suggest that you do not touch that pref.

Had the same problem with firefox and outlook web.

My solution was: 

  open "about:config" in firefox (type it in the webadress line and hit enter)   accept the risk in the pop up   type "clipboard" in the search line   change the following settings (as shown in the image attachment) from false to true (klick on false)   restart firefox (close it & open it again)"

The image attachment mentioned, showed that dom.events.testing.asyncClipboard WAS set to true. So now I am confused :-D.

Is it dangerous to set it true and why?
creator: albruna

title: I can't attach files to Gmail in Firefox and autocomplete contact/texts does not work
content:
Hi all. I hope you are all doing well. Since September the 5th I have been experiencing a problem with my Gmail in Firefox. I cannot attach files in GMail in Firefox nor can I have my contacts automatically appear when I type one or two letters, like it normally does, or have the autocomplete text in the mail body. This does not happen in Edge or Chrome, it works just fine there. The thing is I use 99% Firefox and would love to keep everything in just one browser as I have done until now for many years. It's easier for my job. Can any of you suggesr something that may help me? Thanks in advance.

PS: I unistalled and reinstalled Firefox, nothing changed. PS2: I have AVG antivirus, I had a remote session with an agent who confirmed the problem does not come from the antivirus. PS3: I ran Firefox in troubleshoot mode, nothing changed. PS4: I really now very little about computers so if there's very technical suggestions, I'll appreciate a step-by-step explanation if and when possible, so not do anything stupid.
creator: laurapalaciosa

title: FIREFOX  V130 TLS handshake Issue
content:
When I try to access my bank Firefox waits for 2 minutes performing a TLS handshake with my bank. After this time the issue resolves and I can access my bank. I have not had this issue before. I have tried all the usual resets, eg reboot, delete cookies etc to no avail. This issue has only started in he last few days. I am on win 11 (no recent updates) with AVG Free. I note that FF 130 was installed on 5th Sept.

Any thought on how to clear this problem? Thanks

title: I can't install the extension.
content:
Since version 122 there is a problem with installing the Szafir SDK Web extension. It is necessary to be able to submit signatures online. After installing version 121, I was able to add the extension. After updating Firefox to version 130, the Szafir SDK Web extension still works, wich is good. The problem is that not everyone will handle it this way.

I tried adding the extension manually, but the same message is always returned. "The add-on cannot be installed because it appears corrupted."

Is there any solution to this problem?

title: Accessing Mozilla Account Passwords Without Importing Data
content:
Hello. I have a question out of curiosity regarding Mozilla accounts. Suppose I'm at my aunt's house and need to use her PC to retrieve just one password from my Firefox account. Is there a way to access that password without importing all of my account data into her browser?

I’ve tried logging into my account in a private window, but it still imported everything. In the case of Chrome, Google has a Password Manager that lets you access individual passwords without syncing or importing all data to the browser. Does Mozilla have a similar feature? If accessing a single password is possible, why does it seem so difficult? And if it isn't, why is that the case?

Kind regards, Wiktor
creator: grazynapp65+mozilla
